intro: Talisia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate talisia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. Talisia obovata typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
